ScreenDetailedTop.summary:
The top read-only property of the
interface is a number representing the y-coordinate (top edge) of the total screen area inside the OS virtual screen arrangement, relative to the multi-screen origin.

remarks.para: This is equal to the true top edge, ignoring any OS UI element drawn at the top of the screen. Windows cannot be placed in those areas; to get the top coordinate of the screen area that windows can be placed in, use .

blockquote.para: In Firefox, a non-standard implementation of the top property is available on the Screen interface. See the Non-standard example below for usage details, and see the Screen reference page for browser support information relating to the non-standard implementation.
